content: w s g l le w ir im o y b e in a e b lw o d e d a e b y h c u o ls a owls is a slouchy beanie that has a row of textured owls with beaded eyes and a flat folded crown there are no decreases for the crown the hat is knitted in the round as a tube and finished with a kitchener bind off with the corners tucked in there are 2 options for the brim a double stockinette brim for extra warmth or a snuggier ribbed brim pattern instructions for the owls are both written and charted sizing s m l to fit 19 21 23 head yarn 200-220 yards worsted or dk weight yarn for the double stockinette brim 150-170 yards worsted or dk weight yarn for the ribbed brim hats shown were knit with malabrigo rios worsted weight 100% wool in sunset yellow hat in size m and madelinetosh dk dk weight 100% wool in leopard grey hat in size m gauge 23 stitches to 4 10cm in stockinette using size 6 4 00mm needles needles size 3 3 25mm 16 circulars double pointed needles or 40 with magic loop size 6 4 00mm 16 circulars double pointed needles or 40 with magic loop notions crochet hook for provisional cast on cable needle stitch markers darning needle 18 20 22 pieces size 3 beads or buttons for the owl eyes 1 | p ag e owls ©mirielgw 2018 techniques cables kitchener bind off shown here make 1 purl m1p right shown here instructions select brim style for double stockinette brim using smaller needles cast on 85 95 105 stitches using provisional cast on place marker and join for working in the round the following instructions create a double stockinette brim that is 2 wide if a narrower or wider brim is preferred adjust the number of rounds between rounds 1-15 and 18-33 accordingly rounds 1-15 knit round 16 increase round adds 5 stitches 90 100 110 stitches for s size p17 m1p for m size p19 m1p for l size p21 m1p round 17 purl - this will help fold the brim round 18-33 knit round 34 transfer provisional cast on stitches to a new needle fold cast on edge up underneath so that the wrong side purl stitches are facing together line up the first cast on stitch with the first live stitch purl live stitches together with the provisional cast on stitches as p2tog cast on and live stitch 17x 19x 21x p live stitch for ribbed brim using larger needles cast on 90 100 110 stitches using twisted german cast on place marker and join for working in the round the following instructions create a ribbed that is 1 wide if a narrower or wider brim is preferred adjust the number of rounds between rounds 1-14 accordingly rounds 1-14 knit twisted rib as k3 p2 k3 p2 round 15 purl for both brim
